RSSI A Beacon Latest.description: Latest Available Antenna A, Beacon based RSSI In dBm (Non Valid Default Value shall be : 0)

RSSI A Beacon Histogram.description: Antenna A, Beacon based, Standard RSSI values are defined :0 to -200 dBm, we care about - 20 to - 95; RSSI histogram bin ranges, total(35bins): Greater or Equal - 20 dB(high level signal) (1 bin); - 21 to - 44, a bin for each 8 dB(3bins); - 45 to - 64, a bin for each 4 dB(5bins); - 65 to - 74, a bin for each 2 dB(5bins); - 75 to - 94, a bin for each 1 dB(20bin); Less Then or Equal - 95dBm(1bin); (Non - Valid and Default Per RSSI Value shall be: 0)

RSSI B Data Latest.description: Antenna B, Data Frame based, Latest available RSSI in dBm (Non Valid Default Value shall be: 0)

Legacy BSS Load IE Station Number Histog.description: Based on Beacon and Probe Response Legacy BSS Load IE for the specific BSS connection received by the driver during short measurement periods; Histogram 6 bin range: [1..5, 6..10, 11..15, 16..20, 21..30, Greater than 30]

Legacy BSS Load IE Channel Utilization H.description: Based on Beacon and Probe-Response Legacy BSS Load IE for the specific BSS connection received by the driver during short measurement periods; Histogram bin range: 0 - 255; Histogram bin : 16 bins with a range step 16

Legacy BSS Load IE Available Admission C.description: Based on Beacon and Probe-Response Legacy BSS Load IE for the specific BSS connection received by the driver during short measurement periods; Histogram bin range : 0 - 65535; Histogram bin : 16 bins with a range step 4096

Number of CCA Indications During Tx.description: Counting the Number of CCA indicated when Try to Tx

Number of Tx Attempts.description: Counting the Numbers of Tx Attempts (not Tx due CCA)

Number of Tx Retries.description: Counting the Numbers of TX Retries

Number of Tx MGMT Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Tx Management Frames

Number of Rx MGMT Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Rx Management Frames

Number of Tx Action MGMT Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Tx Action Management Frames

Number of Rx Action MGMT Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Rx Action Management Frames

Number of Tx Other MGMT Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Rest of Tx Non-Above Management Frames - Exclude Beacons! it shall include: - SubType = 0x06 (for Timing Advertisement); - SubType = 0x07; - SubType = 0x09 (for ATIM); - SubType = 0x0a (for Disassn); - SubType = 0x0c (for Deauth)

Number of Rx Other MGMT Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Rest of Rx Non-Above Management Frames - Exclude Beacons! it shall include: - SubType = 0x06 (for Timing Advertisement); - SubType = 0x07; - SubType = 0x09 (for ATIM); - SubType = 0x0a (for Disassn); - SubType = 0x0c (for Deauth)

Number of Tx Data Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Tx Data Frames

Number of Rx Data Frames.description: Accumulated Counter of Rx Data Frames

Number of Tx Packet Loss.description: Accumulated Counter of Tx Packet Loss (Lost Frames - usually MPDUs)

Successful Tx MPDUs per MCS Rate Config.description: Successful Tx MPDUs per Transmit-Config. where Transmit Config is set of (5 * 13 * 2 * 2 = 260 bins): Key - 'BW', 'MCS', 'NSS', 'GI'; Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: 'BW' : '20Mhz', 'MCS' : 'MCS0', 'NSS' : 'SISO', 'GI' : 'GI 1.6'; 'Packet Count' : 3

Successful Tx MPDUs per OFDM Rate Config.description: Successful Tx MPDUs per OFDM Transmit-Config - set of (8 Bins): Key - 'Rate' Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: '12' : '3'

Successful Tx MPDUs per CCK Rate Config.description: Successful Tx Frames per CCK Transmit-Config - set of (4 Bins): Key - 'Rate'; Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: '11' : '3'

Failed Tx MPDUs per MCS Rate Config Hist.description: Failed Tx MPDUs per Transmit-Config. where Transmit Config is set of (5 * 13 * 2 * 2 = 260 bins): Key - 'BW', 'MCS', 'NSS', 'GI'; Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: 'BW' : '20Mhz', 'MCS' : 'MCS0', 'NSS' : 'SISO', 'GI' : 'GI 1.6'; 'Packet Count' : 3

Failed Tx MPDUs per OFDM Rate Config His.description: Failed Tx MPDUs per OFDM Transmit-Config - set of (8 Bins): Key - 'Rate' Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: '12' : '3'

Failed Tx MPDUs per CCK Rate Config Hist.description: Failed Tx Frames per CCK Transmit-Config - set of (4 Bins): Key - 'Rate'; Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: '11' : '3'

Successful Rx MPDUs per MCS Rate Config.description: Successful Rx MPDUs per Receive-Config. where Receive Config is set of (5 * 13 * 2 * 2 = 260 bins): Key - 'BW', 'MCS', 'NSS', 'GI'; Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: 'BW' : '20Mhz', 'MCS' : 'MCS0', 'NSS' : 'SISO', 'GI' : 'GI 1.6'; 'Packet Count' : 3

Successful Rx MPDUs per OFDM Rate Config.description: Successful Rx MPDUs per OFDM Receive-Config - set of (8 Bins): Key - 'Rate' Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: '12' : '3'

Successful Rx MPDUs per CCK Rate Config.description: Successful Rx Frames per CCK Receive-Config - set of (4 Bins): Key - 'Rate'; Value - 'Packet Count'; For example: '11' : '3'

Tx MPDUs Per TID Histogram.description: Tx Packet Per TID From Start of connection (Bins for TIDs 0, 1 ...16, 17;  total of 18 Bins)

Rx MPDUs Per TID Histogram.description: Rx Packet Per TID From Start of connection (Bins for TIDs 0, 1 ...16, 17;  total of 18 Bins)

Number of Bad-CRCs.description: Accumulated Counter of the CRC errors From Start of Connection

Missed Beacon Histogram.description: Histogram of all Missed beacons with the following 3 Bins: 1 - 2 Missed Beacons; 3 - 6 Missed Beacons; Greater or Equal to 7 Missed Beacons
required: Consecutive Greater or Equal to 7 Missed Beacons

RSSI Silence A Histogram.description: Antenna A measures of each frames of the RSSI Between Tx - Rx at 'silence' time - to represent the Noise of the silence for RSSI histogram and bin ranges, total (35bins): Greater or Equal - 20 dB(high level signal) (1 bin) - 21 to - 44, a bin for each 8 dB (3bins) - 45 to - 64, a bin for each 4 dB (5bins) - 65 to - 74, a bin for each 2 dB(5bins) - 75 to - 94, a bin for each 1 dB (20bin) Smaller or Equal - 95dBm (1bin) (Non - Valid and Default Per RSSI Value shall be: 0)

RSSI Silence B Histogram.description: Antenna B measures of each frames of the RSSI Between Tx - Rx at 'silence' time - to represent the Noise of the silence for RSSI histogram and bin ranges, total (35bins): Greater or Equal - 20 dB(high level signal) (1 bin) - 21 to - 44, a bin for each 8 dB (3bins) - 45 to - 64, a bin for each 4 dB (5bins) - 65 to - 74, a bin for each 2 dB(5bins) - 75 to - 94, a bin for each 1 dB (20bin) Smaller or Equal - 95dBm (1bin) (Non - Valid and Default Per RSSI Value shall be: 0)

Frequency Errors Histogram.description: Frequency Error values histogram bin ranges: Less Than 2kHz (1 bin); 2kHz to 10kHz: a bin for each 2kHz (4 bins); 11kHz to 30kHz : a bin for each 4kHz (5 bins); 31kHz to 70Khz : a bin for each 8kHz (5 bins); 71kHz to 198Khz : a bin for each 16kHz (8 bins); Greater than 198kHz (1bin)

SNR A Histogram.description: Antenna A SNR Values histogram bin ranges: - Greater or Equal 40dB (1 bin) - 40dB to 1dB: a bin for each 1dB (39 bins) - Smaller or Equal 0dB (1bin)

SNR B Histogram.description: Antenna B SNR Values histogram bin ranges: - Greater or Equal 40dB (1 bin) - 40dB to 1dB: a bin for each 1dB (39 bins) - Smaller or Equal 0dB (1bin)

Driver View of Channel Utilization Histo.description: STA load for connection statistics periods. Histogram bin range: 0 - 255 Histogram bin: 16 bins with a range step 16

RSSI B Beacon Short Period Histogram.description: Antenna B, Beacon based, Short Period RSSI values are defined :0 to-200 dBm; we care about - 20 to - 95; RSSI histogram bin ranges, total(35bins): Greater or Equal - 20 dB(high level signal) (1 bin); - 21 to - 44, a bin for each 8 dB (3bins); - 45 to - 64, a bin for each 4 dB (5bins); - 65 to - 74, a bin for each 2 dB (5bins); - 75 to - 94, a bin for each 1 dB (20bin); Smaller or Equal - 95dBm (1bin); (Non - Valid and Default Per RSSI Value shall be: 0)

RSSI B Data Short Period Histogram.description: Antenna B, Data Frame based, Short Period RSSI values are defined :0 to-200 dBm; we care about - 20 to - 95; RSSI histogram bin ranges, total(35bins): Greater or Equal - 20 dB(high level signal) (1 bin); - 21 to - 44, a bin for each 8 dB (3bins); - 45 to - 64, a bin for each 4 dB (5bins); - 65 to - 74, a bin for each 2 dB (5bins); - 75 to - 94, a bin for each 1 dB (20bin); Smaller or Equal - 95dBm (1bin); (Non - Valid and Default Per RSSI Value shall be: 0)

Legacy BSS Load IE Station Number Short.description: Based on Beacon and Probe Response Legacy BSS Load IE for the specific BSS connection received by the driver during short measurement periods; Histogram 6 bin range: [1..5, 6..10, 11..15, 16..20, 21..30, Greater than 30]

Legacy BSS Load IE Available Admission C.description: Based on Beacon and Probe-Response Legacy BSS Load IE for the specific BSS connection received by the driver during short measurement periods; Histogram bin range : 0 - 65535; Histogram bin : 16 bins with a range step 4096

Frequency Errors Short Period Histogram.description: Frequency Error short period values histogram bin ranges: Less Than 2kHz (1 bin); 2kHz to 10kHz: a bin for each 2kHz (4 bins); 11kHz to 30kHz : a bin for each 4kHz (5 bins); 31kHz to 70Khz : a bin for each 8kHz (5 bins); 71kHz to 198Khz : a bin for each 16kHz (8 bins); Greater than 198kHz (1bin)

SecondCommandDefined.description: Any User defined IP address, Recommended  Public Cloud/Server (e.g. www.google.com, or www.Intel.com- 104.80.90.29)

MAC Address.description:
Datapoint of the MAC Address Identifier of the Local Wireless product representing usually the Self MAC Address (may be created dynamically, and the one that is actually used).

RandomString.description: A randomly generated string used in the command response

SSID.description: The Current Wi-Fi SSID (Network Name) The Device Is Connected To

Band.description: The Current Band used by this Network (AP)

Channel.description: The Current Channel used by this Network (AP)

Channel Width.description: The Actual used Channel Width in this network

Total Rx Air Time.description: Total Rx Only Air Time from Start of the connection In Micro-Seconds
